arm_group.description: Nicotine dependent individuals otherwise medically healthy
Medically healthy individuals who do not smoke

brief_summary.textblock:
To examine the influence of current daily tobacco smoking on brain activation during stress,
      tobacco cue, and neutral relaxing conditions

clinical_study.brief_title: fMRI of Stress in Smoking Behavior

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects will participate in an fMRI session to examine changes in frontal and limbic brain
      regions with tobacco cues, stress and neutral/relaxing imagery. During each fMRI session
      subjects will participate in six imagery trials: 2 different neutral/relaxing, 2 different
      stress and 2 different tobacco cue scripts.

study_pop.textblock:
30 tobacco dependent and 30 matched healthy controls who have never smoked will be
        recruited for this study

clinical_study.official_title: fMRI of Stress in Smoking Behavior

primary_outcome.measure: No outcome measures for this study, this is an imaging study only

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
